intro: Pseuduvaria setosa, commonly known as the hairy pseuduvaria, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and hairy foliage, which give it its common name. It typically grows as an understory shrub in humid, shaded environments. Its botanical features make it a subject of interest in both horticulture and ecological studies.
